summary: User requests a batched result retrieval method for workflow executions to improve performance when processing large numbers of results. Currently, sequential retrieval of 1000 executions takes ~1 minute, making 1M executions infeasible (~1000 minutes).
userImpact: Users generating reports from large numbers of workflow execution results face unacceptable processing times that scale linearly with execution count.
rootCause: Sequential retrieval of workflow results requires a separate API call per execution, creating a bottleneck for bulk operations.
proposedFix: Add a dedicated method for batched result retrieval that allows concurrent fetching of multiple execution results, potentially using Promise.all() to parallelize requests.
workaround: User can manually chunk workflows.executions into batches and use Promise.all() to fetch results concurrently, though they are uncertain if this is the correct approach.
keyQuote: it takes around ~1min to process 1000 executions, so for 1KK executions -> ~1000 minutes, which is not acceptable
